report_title: Mineral Product Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Mineral product manufacturers refine mineral wool used for insulation, cut stone products, ground or treated mineral and earth and other nonmetallic mineral products such as built-up mica, stucco and dry-mix concrete. Manufacturers benefited during the current period from high wages and low unemployment, which caused aggregate private investment to gain. Higher private investment enabled companies to spend more on nonresidential construction, boosting downstream demand for the industry. Private investment fell during the COVID-19 pandemic, which caused revenue to slump in 2020.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Soaring Private Investment Boosted Sales in the Years Preceding the COVID-19 Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Before the COVID-19 pandemic rocked the world economy, unemployment was at record lows and wage growth was rapid. Since consumers were spending heavily, corporate profit was high so private investment surged. Elevated private investment caused corporations to invest more in office space and other types of nonresidential construction, increasing the need for mineral products and causing revenue to skyrocket in 2019.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The COVID-19 Pandemic Caused Consumer Spending to Plunge
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: When the pandemic hit, state and local governments shut down businesses and enforced quarantines, halting economic activity and sinking consumer spending. As fewer households spent on manufactured goods, companies didn't need as many mineral products to produce them, so the COVID-19 pandemic caused revenue to creep downward.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Have Constrained Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic recovery has disrupted supply chains, contributing to towering inflation in 2022. To bring down prices, the Federal Reserve raised interest rates, in turn restricting demand from residential construction.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Weakened International Trade Poses a Threat to Operators
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic halted imports and exports, and supply chain issues have kept trade volumes relatively low. This has reduced the number of products manufacturers can ship to other countries, reducing manufacturers' revenue streams. The US dollar has also appreciated, making domestically produced goods more expensive to foreign buyers and reducing exports and sales for manufacturers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High Energy Prices Provide a Modest Lifeline for the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The conflict in Ukraine and supply chain disruptions pushed oil and gas prices to record highs. Households have proceeded to increase their investment in better insulation systems to save money on heating. Since mineral wool is used for insulation, manufacturers have found a new revenue stream because of high energy prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Steadily Rising Incomes Will Likely Boost Aggregate Private Investment
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite economic challenges from the COVID-19 pandemic, elevated inflation, soaring interest rates and recessionary fears, the economy will perform well during the outlook period. As GDP rises, incomes will steadily increase, spurring consumer spending. More consumer spending will boost corporate profit and aggregate private investment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE HOUSING MARKET IS EXPECTED TO RECOVER AS HOUSEHOLDS ADJUST TO HIGHER RATES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Interest rates are expected to remain elevated through 2028, but households will adjust by changing their saving and spending patterns. Once households and individuals accumulate enough savings to purchase property again, the housing market will recover. As homebuying increases, demand for mineral products will creep upward, enhancing revenue for manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EXPORTS WILL LIKELY BENEFIT FROM A DEPRECIATING DOLLAR
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Inflationary pressures are expected to sink the value of the US dollar, making domestically produced goods less expensive to purchase abroad. This will likely attract foreign markets to US-produced goods.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INNOVATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO GIVE MANUFACTURERS A LEG UP AGAINST SUBSTITUTES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Mineral product manufacturers will adopt better products to compete more effectively with substitutes such as brick, wood, metal and plastic makers.

industry_definition: The Mineral Product Manufacturing industry produces mineral wool insulation (i.e., fiberglass insulation, rock wool and slag wool) from siliceous materials such as glass, rock and slag. The industry also produces nonmetallic mineral products such as dry mix concrete, mica products, stucco products and synthetic stones.
key_trends: There is intense internal competition among mineral product manufacturers. Manufacturers compete heavily based on price and product quality.
Since mineral products are primarily used for building, there are many substitutes.
Manufacturers benefited from soaring private investment before and during the COVID-19 pandemic and a strong housing market.
However, the industry currently faces challenges from high interest rates, which reduce downstream demand from residential markets.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Renovations are the backbone of the industry.
Demand for mineral products in residential markets is also high.
Nearly half of revenue is generated in the commercial and institutional building construction markets.
Manufacturers of automobiles and major appliances buy fiberglass and rock wool products for insulation.

products_and_services.product_description: Mineral wool insulation products are made from bonding agents and fibers made from glass, rock or slag.
Cut stone products are primarily used for home structures and include architectural stone sculptures.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Ground or Treated Mineral and Earth Products
products_and_services.product_description: Ground or treated minerals and earth include clays, ceramic and refractory materials.
Other nonmetallic mineral products include built-up mica.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Post-COVID recovery eased restrictions on trade from foreign markets.

international_trade_points.trade_title: THE RECENT TRADE WAR WITH CHINA CREATED TURMOIL
international_trade_points.trade_description: To spur domestic production, the Trump Administration imposed tariffs on China.

business_locations.location_description: Households are moving to states in the Southeast in record numbers.
The Great Lakes region is home to a host of manufacturing industries.
The Mid-Atlantic region contains the country's largest private equity firms.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE ABILITY TO PASS ON HIGH PRICES KEEPS PURCHASE COSTS LEVEL
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers have been able to pass on high prices to their buyers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While the significance of labor and capital depends on the product segment, capital is a more significant barrier to entry overall.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Shifting Interest Rates Foster Massive Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The rate of interest determines how expensive it is to purchase a home, with higher interest rates making them less affordable.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: MORE DURABLE MINERAL WOOL INCREASES EFFICIENCY AND SAFETY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: To improve sales, mineral wool manufacturers have been introducing high-density products.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Operators' sales heavily depend on construction, which follows trends in the general economy.
